00001 #ifndef _COMMON_H
00002 #define _COMMON_H
00003 
00004 #ifdef __cplusplus
00005 extern "C" {
00006 #endif
00007     
00008 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00009 //      Definitions
00010 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00011 
00012 /*
00013   \brief ATTR_PACKED
00014   
00015   \f[
00016     |I_2|=\left| \int_{0}^T \psi(t) 
00017              \left\{ 
00018                 u(a,t)-
00019                 \int_{\gamma(t)}^a 
00020                 \frac{d\theta}{k(\theta,t)}
00021                 \int_{a}^\theta c(\xi)u_t(\xi,t)\,d\xi
00022              \right\} dt
00023           \right|
00024   \f]
00025 
00026 */    
00027 
00028 #define ATTR_PACKED __attribute__((__packed__))
00029 
00030 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00031 //      Types
00032 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00033 
00034 // Boolean type (if not C++)
00035 #ifndef __cplusplus
00036 typedef enum { false = 0, true = 1 } bool;
00037 #endif
00038 
00039 typedef unsigned char uchar;
00040 typedef unsigned int uint;
00041 typedef unsigned short ushort;
00042 typedef unsigned long ulong;
00043 
00044 // \brief  Generic callback function type
00045 // Since ARM Procedure Call standard allow for 4 parameters to be stored in r0-r3 
00046 // instead of being pushed on the stack, functions with less than 4 parameters can 
00047 // be cast into a callback in a transparent way.
00048 //
00049 typedef void (*Callback_f)( uint, uint, uint, uint );
00050 
00051 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052 //      Macros
00053 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054 
00055 // Set or clear flag(s) in a register
00056 #define SET(register, flags)        ((register) |= (flags))
00057 #define CLEAR(register, flags)      ((register) &= ~(flags))
00058 
00059 // Poll the status of flags in a register
00060 #define ISSET(register, flags)      (((register) & (flags)) == (flags))
00061 #define ISCLEARED(register, flags)  (((register) & (flags)) == 0)
00062 
00063 // Returns the higher/lower byte of a word
00064 #define HBYTE(word)                 ((uchar) ((word) >> 8))
00065 #define LBYTE(word)                 ((uchar) ((word) & 0x00FF))
00066 
00067 // \brief  Converts a byte array to a word value using the big endian format
00068 #define WORDB(bytes)            ((ushort) ((bytes[0] << 8) | bytes[1]))
00069 
00070 // \brief  Converts a byte array to a word value using the big endian format
00071 #define WORDL(bytes)            ((ushort) ((bytes[1] << 8) | bytes[0]))
00072 
00073 // \brief  Converts a byte array to a dword value using the big endian format
00074 #define DWORDB(bytes)   ((uint) ((bytes[0] << 24) | (bytes[1] << 16) \
00075                                          | (bytes[2] << 8) | bytes[3]))
00076 
00077 // \brief  Converts a byte array to a dword value using the big endian format
00078 #define DWORDL(bytes)   ((uint) ((bytes[3] << 24) | (bytes[2] << 16) \
00079                                          | (bytes[1] << 8) | bytes[0]))
00080 
00081 // \brief  Stores a dword value in a byte array, in big endian format
00082 #define STORE_DWORDB(dword, bytes) \
00083     bytes[0] = (uchar) ((dword >> 24) & 0xFF); \
00084     bytes[1] = (uchar) ((dword >> 16) & 0xFF); \
00085     bytes[2] = (uchar) ((dword >> 8) & 0xFF); \
00086     bytes[3] = (uchar) (dword & 0xFF);
00087 
00088 // \brief  Stores a word value in a byte array, in big endian format
00089 #define STORE_WORDB(word, bytes) \
00090     bytes[0] = (uchar) ((word >> 8) & 0xFF); \
00091     bytes[1] = (uchar) (word & 0xFF);
00092 
00093 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00094 //      Inline functions
00095 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00096 
00097 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00098 // \brief  Returns the minimum value between two integers
00099 // \param  dValue1 First value to compare
00100 // \param  dValue2 Second value to compare
00101 // \return Minimum value between two integers
00102 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103 static inline uint min( uint dValue1, uint dValue2 )
00104 {
00105     return dValue1 < dValue2 ? dValue1 : dValue2;
00106 }
00107 
00108 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00109 // \brief  Returns the index of the last set (1) bit in an integer
00110 // \param  dValue Integer value to parse
00111 // \return Position of the leftmost set bit in the integer
00112 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00113 static inline signed char lastSetBit(uint dValue)
00114 {
00115     int bIndex = -1;
00116 
00117     if( dValue & 0xFFFF0000 )
00118     {
00119         bIndex += 16;
00120         dValue >>= 16;
00121     }
00122 
00123     if( dValue & 0xFF00 )
00124     {
00125         bIndex += 8;
00126         dValue >>= 8;
00127     }
00128 
00129     if( dValue & 0xF0 )
00130     {
00131         bIndex += 4;
00132         dValue >>= 4;
00133     }
00134 
00135     if( dValue & 0xC )
00136     {
00137         bIndex += 2;
00138         dValue >>= 2;
00139     }
00140 
00141     if( dValue & 0x2 )
00142     {
00143         bIndex += 1;
00144         dValue >>= 1;
00145     }
00146 
00147     if( dValue & 0x1 )
00148     {
00149         bIndex++;
00150     }
00151 
00152     return bIndex;
00153 }
00154 
00155 #ifdef __cplusplus
00156 } // extern "C"
00157 #endif
00158 
00159 #endif // _COMMON_H
